title: Create step_sec_integration_window
description:
Create new step to define the region for MW integration with optional auto-detection.

New file: R/step_sec_integration_window.R

Interface:
step_sec_integration_window(
  recipe,
  start = NULL,
  end = NULL,
  auto_detect = TRUE,
  extend_beyond_cal = 0.5,  # fraction to extend beyond calibration range
  ...
)

Implementation:
- During prep: determine window bounds from calibration or signal
- Store as step attributes
- Add .integration_window attribute to measure columns
- step_sec_mw_averages() uses this window if present

Reference: packages/sec/R/analyze.R for integration window logic

title: Add GAM calibration to step_sec_conventional_cal
description:
Extend step_sec_conventional_cal() to support GAM (Generalized Additive Model) calibration using mgcv.

Changes to R/step_sec_conventional_cal.R:
- Add 'gam' to fit_type options: c('cubic', 'quadratic', 'linear', 'fifth', 'gam')
- Add .fit_gam_calibration() internal function using mgcv via parsnip
- GAM uses cubic splines (bs='cs') with REML smoothing
- Fall back to linear if < 4 unique points
- Add mgcv to Suggests in DESCRIPTION

Port from: packages/sec/R/calibration_utils.R fit_gam_calibration()

GAM is preferred for complex, non-linear calibration curves.
close_reason: Added GAM calibration to step_sec_conventional_cal with adaptive k knots for flexible calibration curves

title: Create step_sec_exclude_regions
description:
Create new step to mark regions for exclusion from analysis (solvent peaks, artifacts, flow markers).

New file: R/step_sec_exclude_regions.R

Interface:
step_sec_exclude_regions(
  recipe,
  regions = NULL,  # data.frame with start, end columns
  purpose = c('baseline', 'integration', 'both'),
  ...
)

Implementation:
- Store excluded regions as step attribute
- Add .excluded_regions column to measure_tbl
- Downstream steps check for exclusions
- Support sample-specific or global exclusions

Reference: packages/sec/R/analyze.R apply_baseline_exclusions()

title: Create step_sec_peaks_detect with finderskeepers
description:
Create SEC-optimized peak detection step with finderskeepers as default algorithm.

New file: R/step_sec_peaks_detect.R

Interface:
step_sec_peaks_detect(
  recipe,
  method = c('finderskeepers', 'prominence', 'derivative'),
  min_height_sigma = 3,
  min_distance_ml = 0.3,
  min_peak_area_pct = 0.5,
  loess_span = 0.01,  # for finderskeepers
  ist_points = 50,    # IST grid points
  ...
)

finderskeepers algorithm (default):
- LOESS smoothing (span configurable)
- Iterative Soft Thresholding (IST) with nonlinear spacing
- Changepoint analysis for automatic threshold detection

Port from: packages/sec/R/find-peaks.R finderskeepers() lines 5-189

Also wraps step_measure_peaks_detect() for prominence/derivative methods.

title: Add RF baseline method to step_sec_baseline
description:
Add RF (Robust Fitting) baseline correction using IDPmisc::rfbaseline().

Changes to R/step_sec_baseline.R:
- Add 'rf' to method options: c('linear', 'median', 'spline', 'rf')
- Add rf_span = 2/3 parameter (fraction of data for smoothing)
- Add rf_maxit = c(20, 20) parameter (iterations)
- Add .compute_rf_baseline() internal function
- Include signal variance check (return constant if flat)
- Add IDPmisc to Suggests in DESCRIPTION

Port from: packages/sec/R/baseline.R fit_rf_baseline()

RF baseline is the default in the main sec package - better for complex baselines.
close_reason: Added RF baseline method using IDPmisc::rfbaseline(). Includes rf_span and rf_maxit parameters, validation, tidy output, required_pkgs updates, and 6 new tests. All 761 tests passing.

title: Add MW uncertainty propagation to step_sec_mw_averages
description:
Add uncertainty propagation to step_sec_mw_averages() for analytical validation.

Changes to R/step_sec_mw_averages.R:
- Add include_uncertainty = FALSE parameter
- Add calibration_error = NULL parameter
- Add .calculate_mw_uncertainties() internal function
- Output columns: mn_uncertainty, mw_uncertainty, mz_uncertainty, dispersity_uncertainty
- Propagate calibration RMSE (log10 MW) through Mn/Mw/Mz/PDI formulas
- Update tidy() to include uncertainty metrics

Port from: packages/sec/R/analyze.R calculate_mw_uncertainties()

Critical for ISO 17025 and analytical validation compliance.
close_reason: Added MW uncertainty propagation with include_uncertainty and calibration_error parameters

title: Create step_sec_peaks_deconvolve wrapper
description:
Create SEC-optimized deconvolution wrapper with smart initialization.

New file: R/step_sec_peaks_deconvolve.R

Interface:
step_sec_peaks_deconvolve(
  recipe,
  model = c('gaussian', 'emg', 'bigaussian'),
  optimizer = c('L-BFGS-B', 'Nelder-Mead'),
  smart_init = TRUE,
  max_iter = 100L,
  ...
)

Implementation:
- Wraps step_measure_peaks_deconvolve() with SEC defaults
- Ports sec's smart initialization logic
- Registers SEC-specific peak models (Fraser-Suzuki, etc.) in zzz.R
- EMG is common for chromatography tailing

Reference: packages/sec/R/deconvolve-peaks.R, deconv_initialization.R
